definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A forensic scientist there tells Holloway’s father it’s bone from a human female.
sentences.chinese: 那里的法医学家告诉哈勒维的父亲这个骨头是女性的。

sentences.english: Jessica, a 42-year-old forensic scientist, is typical of the lucky group.
sentences.chinese: 四十二岁的法医学家杰西卡是幸运组的典型。

sentences.english: Eating fruit is regarded as the golden rule and precious percept after a meal, but physicians put forward the objection.
sentences.chinese: 饭后一只果被奉为金科玉律，但医学家却提出了异议。

sentences.english: Li Jianyi was a traditional Chinese physician with great achievements in modern times.
sentences.chinese: 李健颐是近现代医学史上一位颇有建树的中医学家。

sentences.english: A practicing forensic scientist has a built-in bias or predisposition toward the prosecution's side.
sentences.chinese: 开业的法医学家对辩方有一种固有的偏爱或倾向。

sentences.english: Smallpox inoculation or variolation is a great invention of medicine in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 人痘接种预防天花是中国古代医学家的伟大发明。

sentences.english: Li Shizhen(1518–1593), was one of the greatest physicians and pharmacologists.
sentences.chinese: 李时珍是最伟大的医学家和药理学家之一。

sentences.english: REBT pays more attention to the collaboration between the therapist and patient.
sentences.chinese: REBT更注重临床医学家和病人之间的协作。

sentences.english: Forensic experts will begin to examine victims' remains from today.
sentences.chinese: 法医学家将从今天开始这项工作。

sentences.english: I had a best friend for a while who was a professional therapist.
sentences.chinese: 我之前有位挚友，她是个专业的临床医学家。

definition: Li Shizhen (1518-1593), Ming botanist and pharmacologist, author of Compendium of Medical Herbs 本草綱目|本草纲目[Ben3 cao3 Gang1 mu4]
Prescriptions Worth a Thousand in Gold, early Tang compendium of herbal medicine by Sun Simiao 孫思邈|孙思邈[Sun1 Si1 miao3]
Sun Simiao (c. 581-682), doctor and herbalist of the Sui and Tang dynasty, author of Prescriptions Worth a Thousand in Gold 千金要方[Qian1 jin1 Yao4 fang1]
